meanings.definition: To create or spread myths or legends.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys mythologizing stories for her children at bedtime.
meanings.sent2: The author is mythologizing ancient tales in his new book.
meanings.sent3: The kids laughed at her mythologizing of how the family dog got its name.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like mythologizing the history of the town into a grand adventure.
meanings.sent5: The artist's paintings are mythologizing famous events in a unique way.

meanings.sent1: He keeps mythologizing his achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent2: The movie mythologizes the hero's journey to make it more exciting.
meanings.sent3: She was caught mythologizing her cooking skills when her burnt dish was served.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was like mythologizing his promises into unattainable dreams.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement was mythologizing the benefits of the product beyond reality.

meanings.sent1: Her mythologizing of historical events is well-known in academic circles.
meanings.sent2: The museum's exhibit explores the art of mythologizing in different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The children's play was a fun mythologizing of their favorite fairy tales.
meanings.sent4: The book club discussed the impact of mythologizing on society.
meanings.sent5: The documentary delves into the history of mythologizing in storytelling.
